Articles.Content: OK, i have gotten to Duna and back, a orbital mission to dres, but have hit a brick wall, for some reason no matter how hard i try i cannot land and return on Dres. I built a craft that i thought was capable but it is just so big and unwieldy it is useless. 50% collapses on the pad and 50% collapses on ascent. Any suggestions? (dont just give me a ship that can get there)

Try building an interplanetony ship in Kerbin orbit no? Don't think like imbeciles like" To go farther we need to build a bigger rocket and launch it in one launchlol" No, I built a Duna ship in orbit and it is great, it can carry me to Duna and back(maybe even a two-way to the Mun)
How about docking a ship together in Kerbin orbit. It doesn't have to be a large mothership, just a capsule, Lander and propulsion segment. Or you could get a single craft into orbit and re-fuel it?
Eh guys thx for the ideas i was going to save my first orbital construction flight for jool but i guess Dres will be a nice test run for it.
One thing i am worried about is the weakness of docking ports, they seem to wobble alot.

One thing i am worried about is the weakness of docking ports, they seem to wobble alot.

Have you tried the Quantum struts mod?

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/quantum-strut/

Its like a toggle-able strut that works between vessels
Do you need both ships to have connectors, because i have already launched my command module.

Do you need both ships to have connectors, because i have already launched my command module.

Quantum strut connectors? Nope, the struts will attach to the closest part in front of them when turned on.
Well for you guys that helped, thanks! i will give u guys a demo pic of my in-progress mission. Lander and Command Module Docked:
